meanings.definition: To join or unite together to form a whole.
meanings.sent1: She pieced together the puzzle to see the full picture.
meanings.sent2: The tailor pieced the fabric together to make a beautiful dress.
meanings.sent3: He pieced the broken vase back together, but it looked like a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her memories pieced together like a patchwork quilt, forming a colorful tapestry of her past.
meanings.sent5: The detective pieced the clues together, revealing the identity of the culprit.

meanings.definition: To repair or restore by adding pieces.
meanings.sent1: The handyman pieced the broken chair back together.
meanings.sent2: She pieced the torn paper by carefully gluing the fragments.
meanings.sent3: He pieced the shattered mirror back together, creating a quirky mosaic.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was pieced back together after a misunderstanding, stronger than before.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic pieced the engine parts together, making the car run smoothly again.

meanings.definition: To create or complete by adding parts.
meanings.sent1: She pieced the outfit together with a stylish hat.
meanings.sent2: The artist pieced the painting together with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: He pieced the recipe together, hoping it would turn out to be a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: Their teamwork pieced the project together, resulting in a successful presentation.
meanings.sent5: The architect pieced the design together, incorporating modern and traditional elements.
